page.title: 03METHODIST CHURCH
page.content: The Methodist Church at Wadworth was built in 1926. Inside it is not like Wadworth Anglican Church, with bare stone wall, it has smooth painted walls. It has a small organ and a piano, also lots of pews. The 20th Doncaster Wadworth Guides pack meets there every Tuesday except Bank Holidays with song and games. In the Chapel are mostly older people. But unlike the anglican church they do not have weekly services with one one week but not the next week. In the grounds of the chapel there are no graves but grass. Around the back of the chapel there is a vegetable patch which Mr Oxby grows vegetables in. The minister of the church does not live in the village but in Bawtry. Every Good Friday they have a special tea to help raise funds.
